title: When you say a thread "only invites forbidden replies"
body:
But there are several replies and none of them are of the "forbidden" type, is that really a good justification for outright deleting a lament (on GD) about being ghosted because it falls into the "Religion, Sex, Politics, [or] any social issues, though some exceptions may be appropriate" category? Note that posts calling people trash are considered acceptable by Boards mods, and video posts in M&G (there's a specific rule against it) are also considered acceptable by Boards mods.

I think Boards mods need better training and tools to ensure consistency and avoid bias. This would help posters figure out in a logical, deterministic manner what kind of posts are and are not acceptable and make Boards a better place for everyone.

replies.body:

No they're not. Report them.

Also, your thread was titled "I'm so good at languages I'm learning to speak Woman." That's inherently a sexist joke at best, and removable on its own merits. The fact that it invited same sort of inappropriate joke seems decidedly secondary.

When I say I'll look into something, I *do* mean it. I don't always decide on the same action that the person requesting my attention would like, but I *do* see it through.
